caption: Attribute Dictionary
description: The Attribute Dictionary defines attributes and includes references to the classes and objects in which they are used.
name: dictionary

acp.caption: Agent Connect Protocol Specs
acp.description: Specification of agent capabilities, config, input, output, and interrupts.

agp.caption: AGP
agp.description: Indicates support for AGP communication protocol.

agent.caption: Agent
agent.description: An Agent (also known as a Sensor) is typically installed on an Operating System (OS) and serves as a specialized software component that can be designed to monitor, detect, collect, archive, or take action. These activities and possible actions are defined by the upstream system controlling the Agent and its intended purpose. For instance, an Agent can include Endpoint Detection & Response (EDR) agents, backup/disaster recovery sensors, Application Performance Monitoring or profiling sensors, and similar software.

agent_deployment.caption: Agent Workflow Server Deployment Manifest
agent_deployment.description: Describe all the details needed to deploy an agent by the Agent Workflow Server.

agent_interaction_efficiency.caption: Agent Interaction Efficiency
agent_interaction_efficiency.description: Measures the efficiency of agent interactions.

agent_interaction_parallelism.caption: Agent Interaction Parallelism
agent_interaction_parallelism.description: Measures the parallelism of agent interactions.

agent_list.caption: Agent List
agent_list.description: A list of agent objects associated with a device, endpoint, or resource.

agentic_graph.caption: Agentic Graph
agentic_graph.description: Represents the agentic graph for controllability.

algorithm.caption: Algorithm
algorithm.description: The applicable algorithm, normalized to the caption of 'algorithm_id'. See specific usage.

algorithm_id.caption: Algorithm ID
algorithm_id.description: The normalized identifier of the algorithm. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The algorithm is not mapped. See the algorithm attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

annotations.caption: Annotations
annotations.description: Provides additional metadata associated with this release manifest.

authentication.caption: Authentication
authentication.description: This object contains an instance of an OpenAPI schema object, formatted as per the OpenAPI specs: Security Scheme Object.

authors.caption: Author
authors.description: Specifies the authors list of an agent. Values inside the list should satisfy the following grammar: author := author-name .

average_time_needed_to_detect_faulty_age.caption: Average Time Needed to Detect Faulty Agent
average_time_needed_to_detect_faulty_age.description: Measures the average time required to detect a faulty agent.

carbon_footprint_analysis.caption: Carbon Footprint Analysis
carbon_footprint_analysis.description: Evaluates the greenhouse gas emissions associated with AI workflows.

callbacks.caption: Callback Support
callbacks.description: This is `true` if the agent supports a webhook to report run results. If this is `false`, providing a `webhook` at run creation has no effect. If missing, it means `false`.

capabilities.caption: Capabilities
capabilities.description: Declares what invocation features this agent is capable of.

category.caption: Category
category.description: The object category, normalized to the caption of category_id. See specific usage.

category_id.caption: Category ID
category_id.description: The normalized identifier of the object category. See specific usage.

category_name.caption: Category
category_name.description: The class category name, as defined by category_uid value.

category_uid.caption: Category ID
category_uid.description: The category unique identifier of the class.

class.caption: Class
class.description: The class name of the object. See specific usage.

class_name.caption: Class
class_name.description: The class name, as defined by class_uid value.

class_uid.caption: Class ID
class_uid.description: The unique identifier of a class. A class describes the available attributes.

classification.caption: Classification
classification.description: The classification as defined by the vendor.

classification_ids.caption: Classification IDs
classification_ids.description: The list of normalized classification identifiers. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The classification is not mapped. See the classifications attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

classifications.caption: Classifications
classifications.description: The list of malware classifications, normalized to the captions of the classification_id values. In the case of 'Other', they are defined by the source.

completion_rate.caption: Completion Rate
completion_rate.description: Tracks the completion rate of tasks.

config.caption: Configuration
config.description: This object contains an instance of an OpenAPI schema object.

cost_efficiency_per_agent.caption: Cost Efficiency Per Agent
cost_efficiency_per_agent.description: Represents the cost efficiency per agent.

cost_efficiency_per_run.caption: Cost Efficiency Per Run
cost_efficiency_per_run.description: Represents the cost efficiency per run.

cost_efficiency_per_task.caption: Cost Efficiency Per Task
cost_efficiency_per_task.description: Represents the cost efficiency per task.

created_at.caption: Created Time
created_at.description: The time when the object was created. See specific usage.

custom_alert.caption: Custom Alert
custom_alert.description: Tracks custom alerts in the system.

custom_objects_streaming.caption: Custom Objects Streaming
custom_objects_streaming.description: This is `true` if the agent supports custom objects streaming. If `false` or missing, custom streaming is not supported. Custom Objects streaming consists of a stream of object whose schema is specified by the agent in its manifest under `specs.custom_streaming_update`.

custom_streaming_update.caption: Custom Streaming Update
custom_streaming_update.description: This describes the format of an Update in the streaming. Must be specified if `streaming.custom` capability is true and cannot be specified otherwise. Format follows: Schema Object.

decision_success_rate.caption: Decision Success Rate
decision_success_rate.description: Represents the success rate of decisions.

debug.caption: Debug
debug.description: Represents the debug level of observability.

dependencies.caption: Agent Dependencies
dependencies.description: List of all other agents this agent depends on.

deployment_options.caption: Deployment Options
deployment_options.description: List of possible methods to instantiate or consume the agent.  Any of the available option could be used. Every option could be associated with a unique name within this agent. If present, when another manifest refers to this manifest, it can also select the preferred deployment option.

digest.caption: Digest
digest.description: The digest of the targeted content, conforming to the requirements. Retrieved content SHOULD be verified against this digest when consumed via untrusted sources. The digest property acts as a content identifier, enabling content addressability. It uniquely identifies content by taking a collision-resistant hash of the bytes. If the digest can be communicated in a secure manner, one can verify content from an insecure source by recalculating the digest independently, ensuring the content has not been modified. The value of the digest property is a string consisting of an algorithm portion and an encoded portion. The algorithm specifies the cryptographic hash function and encoding used for the digest; the encoded portion contains the encoded result of the hash function. A digest MUST be calculated for all properties except the digest itself which MUST be ignored during the calculation. The model SHOULD then be updated with the calculated digest.

domain.caption: Domain
domain.description: The name of the domain. See specific usage.

error_frequency_count_per_agent.caption: Error Frequency Count Per Agent
error_frequency_count_per_agent.description: Tracks the frequency of errors per agent.

errors.caption: Errors
errors.description: Represents the error level of observability.

extension.caption: Schema Extension
extension.description: Extension model that describes agents and its capabilities more in depth.

extensions.caption: Schema Extensions
extensions.description: List of extension models that describe this agent and its capabilities more in depth.

export_format.caption: Export Format
export_format.description: Specifies the export format for observability data.

feedback_integration.caption: Feedback Integration
feedback_integration.description: Represents the integration of feedback into decision-making.

fingerprint.caption: Fingerprint
fingerprint.description: The digital fingerprint associated with an object.

fingerprints.caption: Fingerprints
fingerprints.description: An array of digital fingerprint objects.

framework_config.caption: Agentic Framework Config
framework_config.description: Config for an agent of an agentic framework.

general_uptime_and_availability_measure_.caption: General Uptime and Availability Measure of the Agent
general_uptime_and_availability_measure_.description: Measures the uptime and availability of agents.

grpc.caption: gRPC
grpc.description: Indicates support for gRPC communication protocol.

hash.caption: Hash
hash.description: The hash attribute is the value of a digital fingerprint including information about its algorithm.

hostname.caption: Hostname
hostname.description: The hostname of an endpoint or a device.

illegal_activity.caption: Illegal Activity
illegal_activity.description: Represents illegal activity in the system.

image.caption: Docker Image
image.description: The Docker image that pertains to the class or object. See specific usage.

info.caption: Info
info.description: Represents the informational level of observability.

input_output_pii.caption: Input & Output PII
input_output_pii.description: Represents PII in input and output.

input_output_sexism.caption: Input & Output Sexism
input_output_sexism.description: Represents sexism in input and output.

input_output_tone.caption: Input & Output Tone
input_output_tone.description: Represents tone in input and output.

input_output_toxicity.caption: Input & Output Toxicity
input_output_toxicity.description: Represents toxicity in input and output.

insights_predictions.caption: Predictions
insights_predictions.description: Tracks predictions made by the system.

interrupt_payload.caption: Interrupt Payload
interrupt_payload.description: An instance of an OpenAPI schema object, formatted as per the OpenAPI specs: Schema Object.

interrupt_support.caption: Interrupt Support
interrupt_support.description: This is `true` if the agent runs can interrupt to request additional input and can be subsequently resumed. If missing, it means `false`.

interrupt_type.caption: Interrupt Type
interrupt_type.description: Name of this interrupt type. Needs to be unique in the list of interrupts.

interrupts.caption: Interrupts
interrupts.description: List of possible interrupts that can be provided by the agent. If `interrupts` capability is true, this needs to have at least one item.

llm_accuracy.caption: LLM Accuracy
llm_accuracy.description: Represents the accuracy of the language model.

llm_answer_correctness.caption: LLM Answer Correctness
llm_answer_correctness.description: Represents the correctness of the answers provided by the language model.

llm_aspect_critic.caption: LLM Aspect Critic
llm_aspect_critic.description: Represents the aspect critic evaluation of the language model.

llm_bias.caption: LLM Bias
llm_bias.description: Represents the bias in the language model.

llm_context_entity_recall.caption: LLM Context Entity Recall
llm_context_entity_recall.description: Represents the recall of context entities by the language model.

llm_context_precision.caption: LLM Context Precision
llm_context_precision.description: Represents the precision of context entities by the language model.

llm_context_recall.caption: LLM Context Recall
llm_context_recall.description: Represents the recall of context by the language model.

llm_error_rate.caption: LLM Error Rate
llm_error_rate.description: Represents the error rate of the language model.

llm_factual_correctness.caption: LLM Factual Correctness
llm_factual_correctness.description: Represents the factual correctness of the language model's output.

llm_faithfulness.caption: LLM Faithfulness
llm_faithfulness.description: Represents the faithfulness of the language model's output.

llm_hallucination.caption: LLM Hallucination
llm_hallucination.description: Represents the hallucination rate of the language model.

llm_noise_sensitivity.caption: LLM Noise Sensitivity
llm_noise_sensitivity.description: Represents the sensitivity of the language model to noise.

llm_relevance.caption: LLM Relevance
llm_relevance.description: Represents the relevance of the language model's output.

llm_response_relevancy.caption: LLM Response Relevancy
llm_response_relevancy.description: Represents the relevancy of the responses provided by the language model.

llm_semantic_similarity.caption: LLM Semantic Similarity
llm_semantic_similarity.description: Represents the semantic similarity of the language model's output.

llm_summarisation.caption: LLM Summarisation
llm_summarisation.description: Represents the summarisation capability of the language model.

llm_toxicity.caption: LLM Toxicity
llm_toxicity.description: Represents the toxicity in the language model's output.

load_distribution_accuracy.caption: Load Distribution Accuracy
load_distribution_accuracy.description: Measures the accuracy of load distribution.

locator.caption: Agent Locator
locator.description: Locators provide actual artifact locators of an agent. For example, this can reference sources such as helm charts, docker images, binaries, and so on.

locators.caption: Agent Locators
locators.description: Locators provide actual artifact locators of an agent. For example, this can reference sources such as helm charts, docker images, binaries, and so on.

measure_for_degree_of_determinism_of_age.caption: Measure for Degree of Determinism of Agentic Workflow
measure_for_degree_of_determinism_of_age.description: Measures the determinism of agentic workflows.

measure_for_dynamism_of_topology.caption: Measure for Dynamism of Topology
measure_for_dynamism_of_topology.description: Evaluates the dynamism of the topology.

most_active_agents.caption: Most Active Agents
most_active_agents.description: Tracks the most active agents in collaboration.

most_failing_agents.caption: Most Failing Agents
most_failing_agents.description: Identifies the agents that fail most frequently.

most_frequently_used_agents.caption: Most Frequently Used Agents
most_frequently_used_agents.description: Identifies the most frequently used agents.

most_frequent_agent_to_agent_interaction.caption: Most Frequent Agent-to-Agent Interactions
most_frequent_agent_to_agent_interaction.description: Tracks the most frequent interactions between agents.

multimodal_answer_relevancy.caption: Multimodal Answer Relevancy
multimodal_answer_relevancy.description: Represents the relevancy of multimodal answers.

multimodal_contextual_precision.caption: Multimodal Contextual Precision
multimodal_contextual_precision.description: Represents the contextual precision of multimodal answers.

multimodal_contextual_recall.caption: Multimodal Contextual Recall
multimodal_contextual_recall.description: Represents the contextual recall of multimodal answers.

multimodal_contextual_relevancy.caption: Multimodal Contextual Relevancy
multimodal_contextual_relevancy.description: Represents the contextual relevancy of multimodal answers.

multimodal_faithfulness.caption: Multimodal Faithfulness
multimodal_faithfulness.description: Represents the faithfulness of multimodal answers.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the entity. See specific usage.

number_of_active_agents.caption: Number of Active Agents
number_of_active_agents.description: Tracks the number of active agents in the system.

number_of_deprecated_or_inactive_agents.caption: Number of Deprecated or Inactive Agents
number_of_deprecated_or_inactive_agents.description: Tracks the number of deprecated or inactive agents.

number_of_tokens.caption: Number of Tokens
number_of_tokens.description: Tracks the number of tokens used.

number_of_unauthorised_calls_blocked_per.caption: Number of Unauthorised Calls Blocked Per Agent
number_of_unauthorised_calls_blocked_per.description: Tracks the number of unauthorised calls blocked per agent.

otel_otp_v1.caption: Otel OTP v1
otel_otp_v1.description: Indicates support for OpenTelemetry OTP version 1.

output_completeness.caption: Output Completeness
output_completeness.description: Represents the completeness of the output.

output_correctness.caption: Output Correctness
output_correctness.description: Represents the correctness of the output.

output_ground_truth_adherence.caption: Output Ground Truth Adherence
output_ground_truth_adherence.description: Represents adherence to the ground truth in the output.

output_instruction_adherence.caption: Output Instruction Adherence
output_instruction_adherence.description: Represents adherence to the provided instructions in the output.

output_uncertainty.caption: Output Uncertainty
output_uncertainty.description: Represents the uncertainty in the output.

parent_uid.caption: Parent Unique ID
parent_uid.description: The unique identifier of an object's parent object. See specific usage.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The path that pertains to the class or object. See specific usage.

pii_leakage.caption: PII Leakage
pii_leakage.description: Represents leakage of personally identifiable information.

planning_multi_agent_collaboration_succe.caption: Multi-Agent Collaboration Success
planning_multi_agent_collaboration_succe.description: Represents the success of multi-agent collaboration in planning.

planning_plan_execution_success.caption: Plan Execution Success
planning_plan_execution_success.description: Represents the success of plan execution in planning.

planning_task_delegation_accuracy.caption: Task Delegation Accuracy
planning_task_delegation_accuracy.description: Represents the accuracy of task delegation in planning.

port.caption: Port
port.description: The TCP/UDP port number associated with a connection. See specific usage.

predefined_alert.caption: Predefined Alert
predefined_alert.description: Tracks predefined alerts in the system.

prompt_perplexity.caption: Prompt Perplexity
prompt_perplexity.description: Represents the perplexity of the input prompt.

prompt_robustness.caption: Prompt Robustness
prompt_robustness.description: Represents the robustness of the input prompt.

query_string.caption: HTTP Query String
query_string.description: The query portion of the URL. For example: the query portion of the URL http://www.example.com/search?q=bad&sort=date is q=bad&sort=date.

rag_answer_relevancy.caption: Answer Relevancy
rag_answer_relevancy.description: Represents the relevancy of answers in RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation).

rag_chunk_attribution.caption: Chunk Attribution
rag_chunk_attribution.description: Represents the attribution of chunks in RAG.

rag_chunk_utilisation.caption: Chunk Utilisation
rag_chunk_utilisation.description: Represents the utilisation of chunks in RAG.

rag_context_adherence.caption: Context Adherence
rag_context_adherence.description: Represents adherence to context in RAG.

rag_contextual_precision.caption: Contextual Precision
rag_contextual_precision.description: Represents the contextual precision of answers in RAG.

rag_contextual_recall.caption: Contextual Recall
rag_contextual_recall.description: Represents the contextual recall of answers in RAG.

rag_contextual_relevancy.caption: Contextual Relevancy
rag_contextual_relevancy.description: Represents the contextual relevancy of answers in RAG.

rag_faithfulness.caption: Faithfulness
rag_faithfulness.description: Represents the faithfulness of answers in RAG.

rating_overall_cost_score.caption: Overall Cost Score
rating_overall_cost_score.description: Represents the overall cost score in rating.

rating_overall_quality_score.caption: Overall Quality Score
rating_overall_quality_score.description: Represents the overall quality score in rating.

rating_overall_security_score.caption: Overall Security Score
rating_overall_security_score.description: Represents the overall security score in rating.

rating_referred_datasets.caption: Referred Datasets
rating_referred_datasets.description: Represents the referred datasets in rating.

rating_referred_evaluations.caption: Referred Evaluations
rating_referred_evaluations.description: Represents the referred evaluations in rating.

rating_referred_metrics.caption: Referred Metrics
rating_referred_metrics.description: Represents the referred metrics in rating.

rating_referred_scores.caption: Referred Scores
rating_referred_scores.description: Represents the referred scores in rating.

recovery_rate_from_failures.caption: Recovery Rate from Failures
recovery_rate_from_failures.description: Tracks the recovery rate from failures.

resource_type.caption: Resource Type
resource_type.description: The resource type as defined by the source.

result_streaming.caption: Result Streaming
result_streaming.description: This is `true` if the agent supports result streaming. If `false` or missing, result streaming is not supported. Result streaming consists of a stream of objects of type `RunResult`, where each one sent over the stream fully replace the previous one.

resume_payload.caption: Resume Payload
resume_payload.description: An instance of an OpenAPI schema object, formatted as per the OpenAPI specs: Schema Object.

risk_assessment.caption: Risk Assessment
risk_assessment.description: Tracks risk assessments in the system.

role_adherence.caption: Role Adherence
role_adherence.description: Represents adherence to the assigned role in a conversation.

scheme.caption: Scheme
scheme.description: The scheme portion of the URL. For example: http, https, ftp, or sftp.

size.caption: Size
size.description: The size of data, in bytes.

skill.caption: Skill
skill.description: A skill that apply to an agent.

skills.caption: Skills
skills.description: Skills that apply to an agent.

specs.caption: Specifications
specs.description: Generic specification schema of this extension.

stability_algorithmic_transparency.caption: Stability Algorithmic Transparency
stability_algorithmic_transparency.description: Represents the transparency of algorithms in stability.

stability_behaviour_consistency.caption: Stability Behaviour Consistency
stability_behaviour_consistency.description: Represents the consistency of behaviour in stability.

streaming.caption: Streaming Modes
streaming.description: Supported streaming modes. If missing, streaming is not supported. If no mode is supported attempts to stream output will result in an error.

subdomain.caption: Subdomain
subdomain.description: The subdomain portion of the URL. For example: sub in https://sub.example.com or sub2.sub1 in https://sub2.sub1.example.com.

task_delegation_accuracy.caption: Task Delegation Accuracy
task_delegation_accuracy.description: Measures the accuracy of task delegation.

text_to_image.caption: Text to Image
text_to_image.description: Represents the quality of text-to-image generation.

threads.caption: Threads
threads.description: This is `true` if the agent supports run threads. If this is `false`, then the threads tagged with `Threads` are not available. If missing, it means `false`.

thread_state.caption: ThreadState
thread_state.description: This describes the format of ThreadState. Cannot be specified if `threads` capability is false. If not specified, when `threads` capability is true, then the API to retrieve ThreadState from a Thread or a Run is not available. This object contains an instance of an OpenAPI schema object, formatted as per the OpenAPI specs: Schema Object.

top_failure_points_in_agent_execution.caption: Top Failure Points in Agent Execution
top_failure_points_in_agent_execution.description: Identifies the top failure points in agent execution.

tool_use.caption: Tool Use
tool_use.description: Represents the effectiveness of tool usage.

tracks_failed_tool_or_api_calls.caption: Tracks Failed Tool/API Calls
tracks_failed_tool_or_api_calls.description: Tracks failed tool or API calls.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of an object or value, normalized to the caption of the type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source. See specific usage.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The normalized type identifier of an object. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

type_name.caption: Type Name
type_name.description: The class type name, as defined by the type_uid.

type_uid.caption: Type ID
type_uid.description: The class type ID. It identifies the class's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_uid * 100 + activity_id.

types.caption: Types
types.description: The type/s of an entity. See specific usage.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier. See specific usage.

unauthorized_agent_calls_blocked.caption: Number of Unauthorized Agent Calls Blocked
unauthorized_agent_calls_blocked.description: Represents the number of unauthorized agent calls blocked.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the class schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the source.

url.caption: URL
url.description: The URL object that pertains to the class or object. See specific usage.

url_string.caption: URL String
url_string.description: The URL string. See RFC 1738. For example: http://www.example.com/download/trouble.exe.

verbose.caption: Verbose
verbose.description: Represents the verbose level of observability.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version that pertains to the class or object. See specific usage.

value.caption: Value
value.description: The value associated to an attribute. See specific usage.

warning.caption: Warning
warning.description: Represents the warning level of observability.

types.caption: Data Types
types.description: The data types available in OASF. Each data type specifies constraints in the form regular expressions, max lengths or value limits. Implementers of OASF should ensure they abide to these constraints.

class_t.caption: Class
class_t.description: Name of the class linked to the object.

datetime_t.caption: Datetime
datetime_t.description:
The Internet Date/Time format as defined in RFC-3339. For example:
2024-09-10T23:20:50.520Z,
2024-09-10 23:20:50.520789Z.

file_hash_t.caption: Hash
file_hash_t.description:
Hash. A unique value that corresponds to the content of the file, image, ja3_hash or hassh found in the schema. For example:
MD5: 3172ac7e2b55cbb81f04a6e65855a628.

hostname_t.caption: Hostname
hostname_t.description:
Unique name assigned to a device connected to a computer network. It may be a fully qualified domain name (FQDN). For example:
r2-d2.example.com.,
mx.example.com.

ip_t.caption: IP Address
ip_t.description:
Internet Protocol address (IP address), in either IPv4 or IPv6 format. For example:
192.168.200.24,
2001:0db8:85a3:0000:0000:8a2e:0370:7334.

json_t.caption: JSON
json_t.description: Embedded JSON value. A value can be a string, or a number, or true or false or null, or an object or an array. These structures can be nested. See www.json.org.

resource_uid_t.caption: Resource UID
resource_uid_t.description: Resource unique identifier. For example, S3 Bucket name or EC2 Instance ID.

subnet_t.caption: Subnet
subnet_t.description:
The subnet represented in a CIDR notation, using the format network_address/prefix_length. The network_address can be in either IPv4 or IPv6 format. The prefix length indicates the number of bits used for the network portion, and the remaining bits are available for host addresses within that subnet. For example:
192.168.1.0/24,
2001:0db8:85a3:0000::/64

timestamp_t.caption: Timestamp
timestamp_t.description:
The timestamp format is the number of milliseconds since the Epoch 01/01/1970 00:00:00 UTC. For example:
1618524549901.
